item.title: Basic Shell commands and How do they execute?
item.description: Shell A shell is a command line interface for UNIX-like operating system. A UNIX system offers a variety of shell types like sh or Bourne Shell bash or Bourne Again shell : It is the standard GNU shell used commonly by Linux users. csh or C Shell ksh or Korn Shell and many more . . You can see what shell are available in your system by running cat /etc/shell

item.title: Free vs Open-Source Software
item.description: Softwares are a integral part of our lifestyle right now. Some of them are proprietary and some of them are not. The one’s which are not proprietary are generally associated with FOSS i.e. Free and Open Source Software. Let’s dig a bit deeper into the non proprietary world. What is FOSS? FOSS i.e Free and Open Source Software, is any piece of software that is freely licenced to use,study,copy and modify and the source-code is openly shared so that people are encouraged to voluntarily contribute to it.
